verses.verse: And David<WH1732> fled<WH1272> from Naioth<WH5121> in Ramah<WH7414>, and came<WH935> and said<WH559> before<WH6440> Jonathan<WH3083>, What have I done<WH6213>? what is my iniquity<WH5771>? and what is my sin<WH2403> before<WH6440> your father<WH1>, that he seeks<WH1245> my life<WH5315>?

And he said<WH559> unto him<WH2486>, God forbid; you shall not die<WH4191>: behold<WH1>, my father will do<WH6213> nothing<WH1697> either great<WH1419> or small<WH6996>, but that he will show<WH1540> it me<WH1>: and why should my father hide<WH5641> this thing from me<WH1697>? it is not so.

And David<WH1732> swore<WH7650> moreover<WH559>, and said, Your father<WH1> certainly<WH3045> knows<WH3045> that I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in your eyes<WH5869>; and he says<WH559>, Let not Jonathan<WH3083> know<WH3045> this<WH6087>, lest he be grieved: but truly<WH199> as the Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>, and as your soul<WH5315> lives<WH2416>, there is but a step<WH6587> between me and death<WH4194>.
Then said<WH559> Jonathan<WH3083> unto David<WH1732>, Whatever your soul<WH5315> desires<WH559>, I will even do it for you<WH6213>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto Jonathan<WH3083>, Behold<WH4279>, to morrow is the new moon<WH2320>, and I should not fail<WH3427> to sit<WH3427> with the king<WH4428> at food<WH398>: but let me go<WH7971>, that I may hide<WH5641> myself in the field<WH7704> unto the third<WH7992> day at even<WH6153>.

If your father<WH1> at all<WH6485> miss<WH6485> me<WH559>, then say, David<WH1732> earnestly<WH7592> asked<WH7592> leave of me that he might run<WH7323> to Beth<WH1035>–lehem his city<WH5892>: for there is a yearly<WH3117> sacrifice<WH2077> there for all the family<WH4940>.
If he say<WH559> thus<WH2896>, It is well; your servant<WH5650> shall have peace<WH7965>: but if he be very<WH2734> angry<WH2734>, then be sure<WH3045> that evil<WH7451> is determined by him<WH3615>.

Therefore you shall deal<WH6213> kindly<WH2617> with your servant<WH5650>; for you have brought<WH935> your servant<WH5650> into a covenant<WH1285> of the Lord<WH3068> with you<WH3426>: nevertheless, if there be in me iniquity<WH5771>, kill<WH4191> me yourself<WH935>; for why should you bring me to your father<WH1>?

And Jonathan<WH3083> said<WH559>, Far be it from you<WH2486>: for if I knew<WH3045> certainly<WH3045> that evil<WH7451> were determined<WH3615> by my father<WH1> to come<WH935> upon you<WH5046>, then would not I tell it you?
Then said<WH559> David<WH1732> to Jonathan<WH3083>, Who shall tell<WH5046> me<WH1>? or what if your father answer<WH6030> you roughly<WH7186>?
And Jonathan<WH3083> said<WH559> unto David<WH1732>, Come<WH3212>, and let us go out<WH3318> into the field<WH7704>. And they went out<WH3318> both<WH8147> of them into the field<WH7704>.

And Jonathan<WH3083> said<WH559> unto David<WH1732>, O Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, when I have sounded<WH2713> my father<WH1> about to morrow<WH4279> any time<WH6256>, or the third<WH7992> day<WH2895>, and, behold, if there be good toward David<WH1732>, and I then send<WH7971> not unto you<WH1540>, and show it you;

The Lord<WH3068> do<WH6213> so<WH3541> and much more<WH3254> to Jonathan<WH3083>: but if it please<WH3190> my father<WH1> to do you evil<WH7451>, then I will show<WH1540> it you<WH7971>, and send you away, that you may go<WH1980> in peace<WH7965>: and the Lord<WH3068> be with you<WH1>, as he has been with my father.
And you shall not only while yet<WH518> I live<WH2416> show<WH6213> me the kindness<WH2617> of the Lord<WH3068>, that I die not<WH4191>:

But also you shall not cut off<WH3772> your kindness<WH2617> from my house<WH1004> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>: no<WH3068>, not when the Lord has cut off<WH3772> the enemies<WH341> of David<WH1732> every one<WH376> from the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH127>.
So Jonathan<WH3083> made<WH3772> a covenant with the house<WH1004> of David<WH1732>, saying<WH3068>, Let the Lord even require<WH1245> it at the hand<WH3027> of David<WH1732>'s enemies<WH341>.
And Jonathan<WH3083> caused David<WH1732> to swear<WH7650> again<WH3254>, because he loved<WH160> him<WH157>: for he loved him as he loved<WH160> his own soul<WH5315>.
Then Jonathan<WH3083> said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, To morrow<WH4279> is the new moon<WH2320>: and you shall be missed<WH6485>, because your seat<WH4186> will be empty<WH6485>.

And when you have stayed three days<WH8027>, then you shall go down<WH3381> quickly<WH3966>, and come<WH935> to the place<WH4725> where you did hide<WH5641> yourself when<WH3117> the business<WH4639> was in hand<WH3427>, and shall remain by<WH681> the stone<WH68> Ezel<WH237>.
And I will shoot<WH3384> three<WH7969> arrows<WH2671> on the side<WH6654> there<WH7971>, as though I shot at a mark<WH4307>.

And<WH7971>, behold, I will send a lad<WH5288>, saying<WH3212>, Go, find out<WH4672> the arrows<WH2671>. If I expressly<WH559> say<WH559> unto the lad<WH5288>, Behold<WH2671>, the arrows are on this side of you<WH3947>, take them<WH935>; then come you<WH7965>: for there is peace to you<WH1697>, and no hurt; as the Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>.
But if I say<WH559> thus unto the young man<WH5958>, Behold<WH2671>, the arrows are beyond<WH1973> you<WH3212>; go your way: for the Lord<WH3068> has sent you away<WH7971>.
And as touching the matter<WH1697> which you and I have spoken<WH1696> of<WH3068>, behold, the Lord be between you and me for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.
So David<WH1732> hid<WH5641> himself in the field<WH7704>: and when the new moon<WH2320> was come<WH4428>, the king sat him down<WH3427> to eat<WH398> food<WH3899>.

And the king<WH4428> sat<WH3427> upon his seat<WH4186>, as at other times<WH6471>, even upon a seat<WH4186> by the wall<WH7023>: and Jonathan<WH3083> arose<WH6965>, and Abner<WH74> sat<WH3427> by Saul<WH7586>'s side<WH6654>, and David<WH1732>'s place<WH4725> was empty<WH6485>.

Nevertheless Saul<WH7586> spoke<WH1696> not any thing<WH3972> that day<WH3117>: for he thought<WH559>, Something has happened<WH4745> him<WH1115>, he is not clean<WH2889>; surely he is not clean<WH2889>.

And it came to pass on the morrow<WH4283>, which was the second<WH8145> day of the month<WH2320>, that David<WH1732>'s place<WH4725> was empty<WH6485>: and Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> unto Jonathan<WH3083> his son<WH1121>, Therefore comes<WH935> not the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> to food<WH3899>, neither yesterday<WH8543>, nor to day<WH3117>?
And Jonathan<WH3083> answered<WH6030> Saul<WH7586>, David<WH1732> earnestly<WH7592> asked<WH7592> leave of me<WH5978> to go to Beth<WH1035>–lehem:

And he said<WH559>, Let me go<WH7971>, I pray you<WH4940>; for our family has a sacrifice<WH2077> in the city<WH5892>; and my brother<WH251>, he has commanded<WH6680> me to be there<WH4672>: and now, if I have found favor<WH2580> in your eyes<WH5869>, let me get away<WH4422>, I pray you<WH7200>, and see my brothers<WH251>. Therefore he comes<WH935> not unto the king<WH4428>'s table<WH7979>.

Then Saul<WH7586>'s anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against Jonathan<WH3083>, and he said<WH559> unto him<WH1121>, You son of the perverse<WH5753> rebellious<WH4780> woman<WH3045>, do not I know that you have chosen<WH977> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> to your own confusion<WH1322>, and unto the confusion<WH1322> of your mother<WH517>'s nakedness<WH6172>?

For as long as<WH3117> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> lives<WH2425> upon the ground<WH127>, you shall not be established<WH3559>, nor your kingdom<WH4438>. Therefore now send<WH7971> and fetch<WH3947> him unto me<WH1121>, for he shall surely die.
And Jonathan<WH3083> answered<WH6030> Saul<WH7586> his father<WH1>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH4191>, Therefore shall he be slain? what has he done<WH6213>?
And Saul<WH7586> cast<WH2904> a javelin<WH2595> at him to strike<WH5221> him<WH3083>: by which Jonathan knew<WH3045> that it was determined<WH3617> of his father<WH1> to kill<WH4191> David<WH1732>.

So Jonathan<WH3083> arose<WH6965> from the table<WH7979> in fierce<WH2750> anger<WH639>, and did eat<WH398> no food<WH3899> the second<WH8145> day<WH3117> of the month<WH2320>: for he was grieved<WH6087> for David<WH1732>, because his father<WH1> had done him shame<WH3637>.
And it came to pass in the morning<WH1242>, that Jonathan<WH3083> went out<WH3318> into the field<WH7704> at the time appointed<WH4150> with David<WH1732>, and a little<WH6996> lad with him<WH5288>.

And he said<WH559> unto his lad<WH5288>, Run<WH7323>, find out<WH4672> now the arrows<WH2671> which I shoot<WH3384>. And as the lad<WH5288> ran<WH7323>, he shot<WH3384> a arrow<WH2678> beyond him<WH5674>.

And when the lad<WH5288> was come<WH935> to the place<WH4725> of the arrow<WH2678> which Jonathan<WH3083> had shot<WH3384>, Jonathan<WH3083> cried<WH7121> after<WH310> the lad<WH5288>, and said<WH559>, Is not the arrow<WH2678> beyond you<WH1973>?

And Jonathan<WH3083> cried<WH7121> after<WH310> the lad<WH5288>, Make speed<WH4120>, haste<WH2363>, stay<WH5975> not<WH3083>. And Jonathan's lad<WH5288> gathered up<WH3950> the arrows<WH2671>, and came<WH935> to his master<WH113>.
But the lad<WH5288> knew<WH3045> not any thing<WH3972>: only Jonathan<WH3083> and David<WH1732> knew<WH3045> the matter<WH1697>.
And Jonathan<WH3083> gave<WH5414> his artillery<WH3627> unto his lad<WH5288>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH3212>, Go, carry<WH935> them to the city<WH5892>.

And as soon as the lad<WH5288> was gone<WH935>, David<WH1732> arose<WH6965> out of a place toward<WH681> the south<WH5045>, and fell<WH5307> on his face<WH639> to the ground<WH776>, and bowed<WH7812> himself three<WH7969> times<WH6471>: and they kissed<WH5401> one<WH376> another<WH7453>, and wept<WH1058> one<WH376> with another<WH7453>, until David<WH1732> exceeded<WH1431>.

And Jonathan<WH3083> said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, Go<WH3212> in peace<WH7965>, forasmuch as we have sworn<WH7650> both<WH8147> of us in the name<WH8034> of the Lord<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, The Lord<WH3068> be between me and you<WH2233>, and between my seed and your seed<WH2233> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>. And he arose<WH6965> and departed<WH3212>: and Jonathan<WH3083> went<WH935> into the city<WH5892>.
